headline: Smaller Dose Approved For Birth Control Pill
snippet: FDA approves smaller dosage form of Ortho-Novum

headline: PRELATES STRESS ROLE OF LAYMEN; All in the Church Are 'People of God,' Council Told A Broader Sense Birth Control Mentioned
snippet: ROME, Oct. 17--Working slowly toward a redefinition of the structure of the Roman Catholic Church, and the relationships among its elements, the Ecumenical Council assessed the role of the laity today for the first time.

headline: JOHNSON SHARES SHOW SHARP RISE; 20 Per Cent Gain Spurred by New Birth-Control Pill Syntex Is Active
snippet: Johnson  Johnson's dis  closure Monday of a cheaper, effective birth-control pill caused its Stock to jump almost 20 per cent yesterday afternoon on the New York Stock Exchange.

headline: Turkey Is Reported Ready To Legalize Birth Control
snippet: Conf, Ankara, ends

headline: GAINS DESCRIBED ON BIRTH CONTROL; Parley Told Device Costing 'Pennies' Will Last a Year
snippet: Simple birth control devices that cost "pennies" and can be effective for as long as a year were described here yesterday as the most promising for mass use.

headline: Chile Supporting Birth Control To Curb Abortions and Deaths; Program of Catholic Nation Described to Seminar in Family Planning Here
snippet: The high rate of abortions and maternal deaths from abortions in Chile has given impetus to Government support of birth control clinics, a Chilean public health authority reported here yesterday.

headline: RESEARCH BACKED ON BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: Natl Health Insts backs pending Sen resolution to expand research

headline: CATHOLICS STUDY RHYTHM SYSTEM; Perfection of Birth Control Method Is Aim of Project at Georgetown Center 5,000 WOMEN IN SURVEY Pilot Inquiry in New York Area Is Used as Basis of Nationwide Program Reports on Study Length of Cycle Recorded
snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27-- The Center for Population Research at Georgetown University, a Roman Catholic institution here, has embarked on a nationwide study of 5,000 Catholic women aimed at perfecting the church-sanctioned rhythm system of birth...

headline: China Birth Control Scored
snippet: Izvestia condemns birth control practices as violation of Marxist policies

headline: SYNTEX REPORTS BIG PROFIT GAINS; Maker of Birth-Control Pills Also Lists Rise in Sales Sales Show Gains Hyster Company OTHER COMPANY REPORTS
snippet: The Syntex Corporation, the pharmaceutical producer whose stock has been soaring on prospects for the company's birthcontrol pills, reported a sharp rise in earnings yesterday. The stock climbed to a new high before the announcement.

headline: ILLINOIS WILL ISSUE BIRTH CONTROL RULE
snippet: Illinois pub aid dept to give birth-control services to only those relief recipients who are married and living with husbands, result of law signed by Gov Kerner providing for study comm on issue; move seen ending dispute

headline: China's Birth-Control Campaign Stresses Sterilization for Men; Specialists' Session Topic Worker's Viewpoint Added
snippet: PEKING. Communist China is laying  new stress on sterilization for men as a way of curbing the growth of its huge population, now officially estimated at 650 million.

headline: Catholics and Birth Control: Role of Research; Scientists Seek Acceptable Methods of Limiting Population Increase

headline: Catholics and Birth Control: Growing Debate; Quickly Turn to Issue Prompt Disagreement View Unchanged Catholics and Birth Control: Debate Grows Over Issue Long Regarded as Taboo SHIFT OCCURRING IN OLD ATTITUDES Frank Discussions Are Held as Clergymen and Laity Re-examine Subject 'Fundamental Right' Conservative Position Views in the Parish Ironic Overtones Puzzled by 'Moralists' Loss of Members Feared High Abortion Rate Article of Protest Spirit of Challenge
snippet: The subject of birth control, long regarded by members of the Roman Catholic Church as a dangerously sensitive issue to discuss, is today stirring a profound ferment in the Catholic community.

headline: Birth Control Fund Added to Aid Bill; BIRTH CONTROL AID IS ADDED TO BILL 240 Million Cut Funds for Alliance
snippet: WASHINGTON, July 19The Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted today to authorize birth control studies and "technical and other assistance" to countries receiving United States foreign aid.

headline: BIRTH-CONTROL AID FOR NEEDY FAVORED

headline: CONNECTICUT KEEPS BIRTH-CONTROL CURB
snippet: Sen kills repeal bill

headline: Birth Control Backed
snippet: Amer Bapt Conv urges US give birth control data and equipment to overpopulated foreign nations

headline: Connecticut House Votes Repeal Of 1879 Birth-Control Law
snippet: HARTFORD, May 14--The Connecticut House of Representatives approved today a bill that would repeal the state's 84year-old birth-control law. The Senate, however, is expected to let the measure die.

headline: SCIENCE NOTES: AID FOR ANGINA; ANGINA ANTIBIOTIC-- BIRTH CONTROL--
snippet: The antibiotic griseofulvin, widely used in the treatment of fungus infections of the skin, has been found to reduce the frequency of attacks in ten patients with angina pectoris, a serious form of coronary heart disease.

headline: DR. ROCK SCORED ON BIRTH CONTROL; Msgr. Kelly Assails Stand on Contraceptive Pills
snippet: The director of the Family Life Bureau of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York yesterday denounced Dr. John Rock, Boston gynecologist, as "a man who capitalizes on his Catholicism, yet speaks not at all out of a Catholic conscience."

headline: ILLINOIS DIVIDED ON BIRTH CONTROL; Welfare Project in Jeopardy With Ouster of Maremont Objection by Catholics
snippet: CHICAGO, May 4--Illinois's controversial birth-control program remains in effect despite the ouster from public office of its leading proponent, Arnold H. Maremont.

headline: DOCTORS BACK AID ON BIRTH CONTROL; Obstetrical Unit Favors Giving Information to Those Who Ask It GROUP IS THIRD TO ACT Resolution, Unopposed, Is Hailed by Advocates of Family Planning Vote Is Secret Turning Point Seen
snippet: The nation's leading organization of obstetricians and gynecologists yesterday voted full approval of providing birth control information to persons who want it.

headline: In The Nation; First Steps in U.S. Aid of Birth Control Eisenhower Hands-Off Policy
snippet: WASHINGTON, April 22--The eminent Harvard, gynecologist, Dr. John Rock, has impressively documented the statement in his book released today that religious groups and other "moral" forces are in general agreement that the human species must soon set...

headline: JESUIT CHALLENGES BIRTH CONTROL PLEA; New Law Dean at Rutgers
snippet: A Jesuit spokesman has entered the new controversy over birth control. He takes sharp issue with the libral views of a Roman Catholic physician published today, citing chapter and verse of papal statements to reaffirm the church's traditional...

headline: ON POPULATION; Ford Fund Grant, Science Academy Promote Birth Control Study Three Factors
snippet: The problem of how to deal with the vast rate of increase of the world's population became the focus of attention again last week with two significant developments. One was the announcement by the Ford Foundation of a grant of $2,

headline: U.S., in a Shift on Birth Control, Offers Aid if Nations Request It; U.S. IS OFFERING POPULATION DATA
snippet: WASHINGTON, April 19--The United States is offering to help nations, on request, with information and other assistance in meeting problems of population growth.

headline: Ford Fund Is Adding 2.8 Million For Research on Birth Control; FORD FUND AIDING IN BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: The Ford Foundation is substantially increasing its contribution toward solving the world population problem.

headline: BIRTH CONTROL AID CALLED ANTI-NEGRO
snippet: CHICAGO, April 15 The Catholic Interracial Council declared today that there were strong anti-Negro motivations behind Illinois' free birth-control program for women on relief.

headline: Illinois Supreme Court Will Get Birth Control Issue This Week; Welfare Chief Presses Fight to Save Program That Provides Special Aid for Women on Relief Rolls Druggists Warned
snippet: CHICAGO, April 13--The controversial Illinois program of birth control for women on relief will go to the State Supreme Court next week.

headline: BIRTH CONTROL SUIT STIRS COURT CLASH
snippet: CHICAGO, April 8--The question of providing birth control aid for women on relief in Illinois produced a shouting match in Cook County Superior Court today.

headline: ILLINOIS IN CLASH ON BIRTH CONTROL; Public Aid Chairman Maps Fight Against Injunction
snippet: CHICAGO, April 5--The battle over the Illinois birth control program for women on relief intensified today.

headline: BIRTH CONTROL PLAN SET BACK IN ILLINOIS
snippet: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., April 4 (UPI)--The Illinois Senate voted overwhelmingly today to outlaw the most controversial provisions of the state's new free birth control program for women on relief.

headline: ILLINOIS ADVISES, ON BIRTH CONTROL; Relief Recipients Counseled --Legislators Fight Plan
snippet: CHICAGO, April 1--A program of birth control for relief recipients in Illinois went into effect today despite pending legislation to block it.

headline: Health and Science; Space Health Messages Drugs Birth Control
snippet: The accelerating and expanding nature of the nation's space program was illustrated in an Administration request to Congress in January to spend some $6,000,000,000 on space activities in the coming fiscal year.

headline: Wyszynski Hits Birth Control
snippet: Cardinal Wyszynski scores birth control, ser attacking Govt program to curb population rise

headline: TWO LOSE APPEAL ON BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Jan. 17 (AP)--The Appellate Division of Connecticut's Circuit Court upheld today the conviction of two officials of a Planned Parenthood Center for violating the state's birth control laws.
